pr_title: Issue number 1003 fixes for OAuth service Indexing

timeline.message: indexes are added for user entity class

timeline.bodyText:
Primary key and foreign keys should have indexes generated by default.
Also we use used a pattern for index names, I believe it was:
<table name>_<index column names>_idx
timeline.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText:
I am seeing this value change all the time between PRs, without any code change.
Please explain why it is being changed yet again?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText:
Initially, temp_reg_id was used in query params for auto sign-in after registration but later changed to camelCase format, angular developer also used tempRegId in their code.
We are not following camelCase format on Entity column names. I also noticed JPA DDL converts tempRegId into temp_reg_id hence asked the developer to change the name to temp_reg_id.
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText:
I was under the impression that hibernate would create indexes for columns with@unique  automatically.
I am not seeing a unique=true annotation on wither user_id or temp_reg_id however.
Please add those annotation first, dump the automatically generated schema, and only add indexes manually if hibernate does not create them automatically.
Also it might be a good idea to export db schema after each db change and include it in the PR so that we can verify indexes are correctly generated.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText:
Fixed review comment. Added unique=true to user_id and temp_reg_id; removed @Index for temp_reg_id and user_id 
CREATE TABLE `users` (
  `id` varchar(255) NOT NULL,
  `app_id` varchar(100) NOT NULL,
  `created` timestamp NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  `email` varchar(320) NOT NULL,
  `status` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `temp_reg_id` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL,
  `user_id` varchar(64) DEFAULT NULL,
  `user_info` json NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`id`),
  UNIQUE KEY `UK_onuvh020q8e92n6pgygqxjgro` (`temp_reg_id`),
  UNIQUE KEY `UK_6efs5vmce86ymf5q7lmvn2uuf` (`user_id`),
  KEY `users_app_id_email_idx` (`app_id`,`email`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci;
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.message:
Removed @Index for user_id and temp_reg_id and added unique=true in @Column for both fields

Removed @Index for user_id and temp_reg_id and added unique=true in @Column for both fields
